result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Corderual Antonio Singletary

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Corderual Antonio Singletary appeared by video.  Attorney Michael J Cerniglia appeared by video for Corderual Antonio Singletary.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 40.
Court orders defendant to continue to comply with Justice Point conditions. Court reminds defendant that bail conditions are still in effect: Maintain Absolute Sobriety, Breathalyzer Testing. Court reminds defendant that the No Contact Order is still in effect. 
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire & Waiver
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 09-13-2022
Received and Filed:  Defendant's Motion to Withdraw as Counsel.

Defendant Corderual Antonio Singletary in court in person with Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn who appears by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Defense motion to withdraw as counsel is granted by the court. Defense counsel will notify Public Defender's Office to appoint new counsel for the defendant. Case adjourned for status of counsel in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Status conference scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed:  State's Notice of Motion and Motion to Increase Bail.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 08-02-2022

Bail ordered based on custodial length of time in case 22CF1136.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring; no contact order.  If an Electronic Monitoring Device (GPS) is unavailable and Cash Bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the Electronic Monitoring (GPS) waiting list.  Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Defendant to be monitored by portable breathalyzers.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Court ordered no contact with Angela P
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Corderual Antonio Singletary in court with attorney Ashley Fard.  Defendant Corderual Antonio Singletary in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Corderual Antonio Singletary appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
